entry.title: How to show file size in Linux terminal
entry.summary:
To list the file size of all the files in the current directory, use the du command

du -sh *
  • -s is for summarize so it gives a total size for a directory
  • -h is for human readable format with units
  • * is for all files. One can change it to a filename to see the size of only that file

entry.title: How to install i3 on Debian 8 in VM VirtualBox
entry.summary:
Forget about fancy desktop environments and do a clean install of the awesome windows manager i3 on Debian 8.

Software

  • VirtualBox 4.3.28
  • Debian 8.1.0 amd64
  • i3 4.8

Reading

  • Xorg screen resolution
  • .bash_profile vs .bashrc

Prerequisites

  • 0.1 How to minimally install Debian 8 in VM VirtualBox

1. Install i3 and xorg

apt-get install i3
apt-get install xorg

2. Create xorg config file

Xorg -configure

(X is upper case) if you get hardware errors, it may be VirtualBox specific and can be ignored

move it to the right place:

cp xorg.conf.new /etc/X11/xorg.conf
  1. Set "startx" to run after login in root do
ls -a

and there is a ".profile" file, nano open it and add to the end:

if [ -z "$DISPLAY" ] && [ $(tty) == /dev/tty1 ]; then
  startx
fi

Some people suggest adding the above commands to ".bashrc" instead, the difference between the two: .bash_profile vs .bashrc

4. Change xorg screen resolution (solution from VirtualBo's Forum)

For this example, we will be setting the resolution to "1920x1080" 4.1. edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf In section "Monitor" add

HorizSync 31-80   
VertRefresh 30-100

In section "Screen" add

DefaultDepth 16

Scroll down to "Display" with Depth 16 and add

Modes "1920x1080"

4.2. Power off the virtual machine and in your host machine use "VBoxManager" to run:

VBoxManage setextradata Debian CustomVideoMode1 1920x1080x16

where Debian is the name of the guest machine

5. Restart the virtual machine and enjoy i3 on Debian

entry.title: How to fix Cinnamon running without video hardware acceleration issue in VM VirtualBox
entry.summary:
Upon initial installation of Cinnamon in VM VirtualBox, you might encounter the pop up window "Cinnamon running without video hardware acceleration"

To fix this, simply check "Enable 3D Acceleration" in the VM settings

entry.title: How to fully enable Xfce windows snapping
entry.summary:
For any excessively tidy people, windows snapping is a must; Xfce is a great desktop environment that provides such features. By default though, it seems that only horizontal snapping works and you'd have to tweak the settings a bit to make vertical snapping function as well.

Software

  • Xfce 4.10

Setting

  • Go to Settings > Window Manager > Advanced

  • and uncheck "Wrap workspaces when dragging a window off the screen"

Happy snapping!

entry.title: How to minimally install Debian 8 in VM VirtualBox
entry.summary:
Debian without a desktop environment is simple, clean and full of potential. It is the ideal set up for installing your own choice of desktop environment that doesn't come with the Debian installer, or for setting up a Debian server.

Software

  • VM VirtualBox 4.3.30
  • Debian 8.1.0 amd64

Reading

  • Debian GNU/Linux Installation Guide

Prerequisites

  • 0.1 Comfortable using Linux without a desktop environment

1. Start the virtual machine

Create a new virtual machine for Debian and start it with the Debian .iso

2. Choose Install

Install and Graphical install is pretty much the same

3. Configure settings to your liking

  • language
  • location
  • keyboard
  • hostname
  • domain name (leave it blank if you don't have one)
  • Users
  • Time zone
  • Partition disks (strongly recommend partitioning if it will be used as a server )
  • mirror (you can leave the proxy setting blank)
  • package usage survey

4. Software selection

First Thing to note is that if you regret not installing anything here, later after Debian is installed and running, you can always run:

tasksel

to install or uninstall anything you missed (except "standard system utilities" is replace by "laptop"; they are not the same; read more: tasksel)

What each package includes:

  • web server: Apache2
  • print server: CUPS (you can deselect it if printing is not needed)
  • SSH server: openssh
  • standard system utilities: What Debian's "standard system utilities" include

4.1. For a bare bone installation with only Debian core:

  • Don't check anything

4.2. For a minimal installation (Recommended):

  • standard system utilities (as this provides Python, whois, ftp, telnet, aptitude and other goodies)

4.3. For a server:

  • SSH server
  • standard system utilities

5. Grub

Select /dev/sda

6. Finish the installation and reboot

VirtualBox will remove the installation .iso for you

7. Update and upgrade

After logging in, update your package list:

apt-get update

upgrade the packages:

apt-get upgrade

Conclusion

Fully utilize VirtualBox's snapshots to save whatever you are doing

entry.title: How to create a symbolic link in Linux
entry.summary:
Symbolic link or Symlink is a file that contains a link to another actual file path. It acts as a pointer and will always point to the "actualFilepath".

Reading

  • man-pages:ln
  • Wikipedia: symbolic link

run

ln -s actualFilePath linkFilePath
  • A Symbolic link links to wherever actualFilePath is; if the original actualFile is deleted and a new file is created with the same name, the Symlink will link to the new file as it still has the same path
  • In "Properties" of the linkFile you can see where it is linked to; if the actualFile does not exist it will show broken link
